pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people in a vehicle. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:8.2: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot, a palanquin, a litter.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:9.1: One should not give teachings to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone in a vehicle who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:10.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:10.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:11.1: The third training rule is finished.
